author: bridge-bot
content:
<sigpaul> Is it correct that when the execution API sends us bytes in the execution_payload.transactions list, those bytes *are not* going to have the SSZ union OpaqueTransaction byte prefix?
I.e., any transaction we get from the execution node should be assumed to be an OpaqueTransaction (Transaction variant 0).

author: bridge-bot
content: <protolambda> Yes

author: bridge-bot
content: <protolambda> There's an issue in GitHub specs open about this transaction typing in consensus

author: bridge-bot
content: <protolambda> But now only 1 type, with many API interaction options, so we're sticking with the simplified thing for now

author: bridge-bot
content: <sigpaul> SGTM, thanks üôè

author: bridge-bot
content: <vdWijden> We return them in the canonical rlp encoding currently (the way it is in eth1) so we support typed and non-typed transactions

author: bridge-bot
content: <vdWijden> Should I change that?

author: bridge-bot
content: <protolambda> No

author: bridge-bot
content: <protolambda> The consensus specs currently wraps that envelope (opaque transaction type) with a Union, with a single type parameter...

author: bridge-bot
content: <protolambda> That's what is kind of underspecified/broken. But not currently blocking any interop effort

author: bridge-bot
content: <protolambda> The specs issue has proposals to fix, and a bit of conversation. But also chatted with Micah in typed envelope discord channel, and couldn't agree on best way forward (even though there's an option that doesn't affect API or execution layer). So as-is for now, a useless 0 byte per union selector in consensus layer until we agree on something better

author: bridge-bot
content: <sigpaul> Well, I hope that redundant little byte enjoys the trip to Greece ‚ò∫Ô∏è

author: bridge-bot
content: <protolambda> Hehe yes. I'll try to outline the issue and sort out a candidate solution with anyone here who has time for it. But let's focus on the bigger things first

You can run them against each-other too: go run . engine, go run . consensus --slot-time=4s (and provide a geth-style genesis.json), see go run . engine --help and go run . consensus --help for options.
